channel.title: HedgeDoc - Collaborative markdown editor
channel.description: Recent content on HedgeDoc - Collaborative markdown editor
channel.copyright: The HedgeDoc developers. Theme based on [vex-hugo](https://github.com/themefisher/vex-hugo).

item.title: Can I run multiple instances on the same database?
item.description: No. The HedgeDoc server process is not entirely stateless and therefore running more than one instance will result in missing/broken content for users.

item.title: History
item.description: HedgeDoc is the community-driven fork of CodiMD, which is the open source pendant to HackMD. Confused? Let us explain: May '15First commit in thehistory of HackMDJuly '15Start of hackmd.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: Preamble: Hosting Details The HedgeDoc landing page is a static site that does not track, collect, store any information, or set any cookies.

item.title: Why is CodiMD now called HedgeDoc?
item.description: The short version: There were two CodiMD-projects on GitHub, the community-driven fork and the original project maintained by the HackMD-team. To solve this naming conflict, our community-driven version was renamed to HedgeDoc.

item.title: Why was the PDF Export feature removed?
item.description: We used a chrome-headless instance to generate the PDFs, but that led to some security vulnerabilities and was therefore deactivated. There are currently plans to re-add this feature in a safe way, but this will most likely take some time and can be expected at the earliest with 2.
